articles.title: Russian Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Russian Aerial Transport Administration led by Director Neradiko Alexandr Wednesday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The guests made bows to the President with boundless reverence for him.
					
					 The head of the delegation wrote in the visitor's book:
					
					 Comrade Kim Il Sung is always alive in the hearts of the Korean people. We pay the highest tribute to him.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Visits Mangyongdae

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Russian Aerial Transport Administration led by Director Neradiko Alexandr visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Wednesday.
					
					 Being briefed on the great revolutionary history of the President and members of the Mangyongdae family, the members of the delegation looked round the historic relics at his old home preserved with care.
					
					 The head of the delegation said, expressing his deep impressions of the visit:
					
					 Kim Il Sung was born into a plain family.
					
					 He grew up under the patriotic and revolutionary education by his parents from his childhood.
					
					 The Mangyongdae family members were ardent patriots who devoted their all to the independence of the country.
					
					 The President is, indeed, the great leader and great person.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Mansudae Assembly Hall, etc.

articles.title: Albanian President Hopes for Detente on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Albanian President Hopes for Detente on Korean Peninsula 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- We hope that the Korean people would register greater achievements in the work for the nation's economic progress and improvement of the living standard and the tension on the Korean Peninsula would be defused as soon as possible.
					
					 Albanian President Bamir Topi said this on Dec. 7 when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador to his country Ju Wang Hwan.
					
					 The president also hoped for development of relations in various fields on the basis of the tradition of the friendly ties existing between the two countries.
					
					 He expressed expectation that the two countries would contribute to defending the world peace and security through mutual cooperation in the international arena.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Swiss Personage
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Swiss Personage
						

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, on the 20th anniversary of his assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Martin Lotscher handed over the gift to an official of the DPRK mission in Bern on December 11.

articles.title: Women in North and South Pledge to Usher in Era of Peace and Reunification
articles.content:
Women in North and South Pledge to Usher in Era of Peace and Reunification 

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Women's Sub-Committee of the North Side Committee and the Women's Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration issued the following joint resolution Wednesday:
					
					 The Koreans have seen lots of women falling victims throughout history interwoven with the Japanese imperialists' occupation, national division, Korean war and Cold War. 
					
					 This convinced the people that peace is a vital and crucial matter related to the nation's destiny.
					
					 Women from the north and the south attended a seminar on peace in Asia and role of women under the situation where the nation remains divided. They have exerted efforts to sow seeds of peace and bring peace into a reality through cooperation for settling the issue of comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army and diverse activities for implementing the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 Exchanges between women in the north and the south have stalled and military tensions run high in the West Sea of Korea amid frayed north-south relations.
					
					 Women in the north and the south crave for peace on this land.
					
					 Hoping that 2012 would become a year of hope in ushering in a new epochal phase for peace and reunification, we, women in the north and the south, pledge as follows:
					
					 First, we will make efforts to avert a war and bring peace as a main player for national reconciliation, unity, peace and reunification.
					
					 We will do our best to remove the root cause of confrontation and war from this land and leave posterity with lasting peace and reunification.
					
					 We will enhance our roles in rejecting all the institutional barriers and theory of confrontation which bar north-south visits, contacts and reunification and harmony but foster discord and distrust.
					
					 Second, we will turn out to implement the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The implementation of these declarations guarantees peace of the country, bright prospect of reunification and future of the nation.
					
					 The only way-out of removing the acute confrontational phase and ushering in the new phase of peace and reunification lies in implementing the north-south declarations, and this will contribute to peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 We will uphold the banner of the north-south joint declarations and flatly reject all confrontational moves which lay a stumbling block in the way of people of all social standings including women's organizations in their efforts to implement the declarations.
					
					 As clarified in the October 4 declaration, we will intensify solidarity activities to turn the West Sea of Korea fraught with the danger of armed clashes and war into a peaceful sea.
					
					 Third, we will actively solidarize for the settlement of the issue of comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army and for the protection of their rights.
					
					 The issue of comfort women has been confirmed as a crime against humanity at the UN and the Japanese government is urged to make apology and reparation.
					
					Wednesday rallies have been held in the south side urging the Japanese government to make repentance, apology and reparation for sexual slavery. The 1,000th rally is due on Dec. 14, 2011. It is regretful that the efforts to hold the 1,000th rally with the attendance of the women from the north and the south could not come true.
					
					 We will hold meetings to hear testimonies and seminars related to the sexual slavery by the Imperial Japanese Army so as to urge Japan to make apology and reparation for its crimes against humanity and all hostile acts it has committed against the Korean nation, and will intensify solidarity with the UN and other international organizations as well as overseas organizations to this end.
					
					 We will foil Japan's moves of reinvasion aimed to infringe upon the sovereignty of the Korean nation typified by its "territorial claim to Tok Islets" by denying and distorting its past history of aggression. 
					
					 Women holding half of the population of Korea will do their best for the country's reunification and peace. 
					
					 We once again affirm our pledge to play a key role in ushering in the bright future of reunification and common prosperity.

articles.title: Light Industry Makes Good Headway in DPRK
articles.content:
Light Industry Makes Good Headway in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Many light industry factories have appeared or undergone technological updating throughout the DPRK. 
					
					 The Pyongyang and Sinuiju textile mills and Pyongyang Mechanical Pencil Factory have put their production processes on a modern basis. 
					
					 The Hamhung Woolen Textile Mill reconstructed the converting and spinning shop to begin producing vinalon cloth, while the Chongjin Chemical Fibre Mill built a rayon production process.
					
					 Footwear factories have produced quality synthetic leather, begun home production of supplementary materials, including adhesive, and developed  an estimated 200 kinds of new products. 
					
					 The Kumsong Foodstuff Factory began producing wheat cakes stuffed with meat and the Pyongyang Stevia Processing Factory has turned into a large sweetening producer. 
					
					 The Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory, Susongchon, Paekunsan and other combined foodstuff factories have boosted production after modernizing their production processes. 
					
					 Changsong, Hoeryong, Kanggye, Tanchon, Musan, Riwon and other cities and counties have updated locally-run factories as required by the new century. 
					
					 Hundreds of thousands of quality goods were displayed at the 2nd Commodity Exhibition of Pyongyang Department Store No. 1, Autumn Commodity Fair of the Pyongyang Underground Shop and National Exhibition of Consumer Goods. 
					
					 Under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, the DPRK has directed great effort to developing the light industry to make a great progress in improving the people's living standard again this year.

articles.title: New Machine to Be Introduced in Next Year's Farm Work
articles.content:
New Machine to Be Introduced in Next Year's Farm Work

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Kye Ung Sang College of Agriculture affiliated with Kim Il Sung University has developed a new-type combined farm machine.
					
					 The machine, attached to tractor, is capable of plowing, harrowing and leveling rice fields simultaneously. 
					
					 It can remarkably improve the rice field management, while sharply reducing tractor's working hours and consumption of fuel.
					
					 The efficient machine is to be introduced in farm work from next year.

articles.title: DPRK Localizes Servo Device
articles.content:
DPRK Localizes Servo Device
						

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Control Machine Institute under the DPRK State Academy of Sciences has succeeded in making servo device necessary for manufacturing CNC (computer numerical control) machine tools.
					
					 The digital servo device, simple in structure and easy to use, makes it possible to ensure high precision and speed operation of alternating-current servo motor.  
					
					 The institute has already applied scores of servo devices to machine factories.
					
					 The servo device enjoys popularity for its rich interface and effective function.  
					
					 The localization of servo device is a big progress in modernizing machine tools.

articles.title: Headgears Popular among Korean Women in Winter
articles.content:
Headgears Popular among Korean Women in Winter
						

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Many Korean women have chosen headgears to wear in winter instead of boa or headscarf. 
					
					 Headgears are made with woolen yarn, leather or overcoat fabric of various colors.
					
					 Pae Ryon Hwa, a 42-year-old woman living in Pothonggang District, Pyongyang, told KCNA:
					
					 "I like to wear a headgear. It is better than boa. I look stylish with this headgear. I think it is also good for health. I had used to wear a boa in winter. But it made me sweat and feel choky. So I had caught cold easily. Since I began wearing a headgear, I have felt better."
					
					 Winter headgear is also economically better than boa or headscarf because woolen yarn for one boa is enough for three headgears.

articles.title: Yaksu-ri Mural Tomb
articles.content:
Yaksu-ri Mural Tomb

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- There is a mural tomb dating back to the period of Koguryo Kingdom (277 B.C. - 668 A.D.) in Yaksu-ri, Kangso District, Nampho City. It is believed to have been built in the late 4th century or early 5th century.
					
					 The tomb consists of a corridor and two chambers.
					
					 All walls and ceilings of the chambers are covered with paintings portraying the life of a couple and four guardians -- mythological turtle symbolizing the God of the North, blue dragon, white tiger and red phoenix.
					
					 The paintings represent the majesty and power of the deceased, Koguryo aristocrats. They include pictures of a magnificent procession, hunting and servants.
					
					 The mural paintings give a glimpse of the might of Koguryo Kingdom and life of its people.
					
					 The Yaksu-ri mural tomb was listed as a world cultural heritage at the 28th session of the World Heritage Committee of UNESCO in July 2004.

articles.title: Hoeryong Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Hoeryong Revolutionary Site
						

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Hoeryong Revolutionary Site is situated in North Hamgyong Province, the DPRK. 
					
					 Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, was born on December 24, Juche 6 (1917) and spent her childhood there till the spring of the year 1922. 
					
					 Her statue was unveiled there on September 22, Juche 58 (1969.)
					
					 Preserved at her old home are an iron pot, tableware, dinner-table, chipped water jar, wooden basin and iron fire pot used by her poor family.    
					
					 Seen in the site are a shallow well, washing place, mill and Mangyang Ferry where there are a monument to her leaving the homeland with her family and a ferryboat. 
					
					 A museum and monument were built in the site to convey her revolutionary activities.

articles.title: DPRK Opera, Very Successful Work: Chinese Papers
articles.content:
DPRK Opera, Very Successful Work: Chinese Papers

					  Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Chinese newspapers reported about the tour performance of the squad of DPRK opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" in China between Nov. 14 and Dec. 8.
					
					 The papers elaborated on the opera, viewing in unison it as a great hit.
					
					 People's Daily said that Korean artistes' attitude of creation and skilful methods of creation made the opera display its touching artistic charm.
					
					 The opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai", which achieved high artistic success in many aspects, will contribute to cultural exchange between the two countries, as another successful Korean version of Chinese classic in the wake of "A Dream of Red Mansions", it added.
					
					 Wuhan Wanbao said:
					
					 Music and fascinating dances of Korean characteristics represented on the stage added new light to the legend long conveyed in China.
					
					 The audience, fascinated by the world of joyful meeting and painful parting in the opera, expressed admiration at the Korean artistes with warm applauds.
					
					 Wuhan Sinbao noted: When telling about the Phibada Opera Troupe, one calls to mind large-scale beautiful dance work. Dances from Korean version of opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" are based on new creative method unprecedented in operas.
					
					 Changjiang Daily said that the opera strictly keeps the creative principles of Korean music, dance, and stereo stage decor in the visual and acoustic aspects while preserving the plot of the original to the maximum.
					
					 The skill of performers is high and their acting is also very delicate, it noted.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slashes at S. Korea's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slashes at S. Korea's Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Campaign 

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are kicking up smear "human rights" campaign against the DPRK by instigating wicked conservative elements and human scum who betrayed the nation.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The campaign is another blatant challenge to the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK and a deliberate act to prevent the north-south relations from improving and escalate confrontation between systems, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is a trite method of the south Korean conservative group to slander the DPRK over its non-existent human rights issue.
					
					 The group's "human rights" racket getting increasingly reckless clearly shows that its oft-repeated "flexibility" is nothing but a spurious signboard to cover up its sinister attempt to escalate confrontation.
					
					 The south Korean ruling forces, driven to a tight corner for their incompetence, failed domestic and foreign policies and public protest and denunciation that followed, are finding themselves in the plight in which it is hard to maintain power, much less winning another term next year. Much upset by this, the group of traitors is becoming desperate in smear "human rights" campaign in a bid to divert elsewhere the public criticism, justify its moves to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen and prolong its remaining days. It is sordid for the conservative group to try to tide over the crisis caused by its treachery by doing harm to the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The group had better be concerned about its own destiny at stake before finding fault with others.

articles.title: U.S. Violation of Sovereignty of Pakistan Slammed: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Violation of Sovereignty of Pakistan Slammed: Rodong Sinmun

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S.-led NATO coalition forces in Afghanistan recently let their fighters attack Pakistani border checkpoints, killing tens of Pakistani troops.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This proves that the U.S. does not respect the sovereignty of Pakistan, far from regarding it as its ally. 
					
					 The U.S. oft-repeated alliance with Pakistan and respect for its sovereignty are just a broad hoax to cover and hush up its crimes.
					
					 With no wordplay can the U.S. cover up its nature as a wanton violator mercilessly infringing upon the sovereignty of other countries.
					
					 The U.S., instead of talking about the human right issue of other countries, should look back upon its history stained with the blood shed by people of different countries including Pakistan, Afghanistan and Iraq.
					
					 Whenever Pakistani people were killed by the U.S. and NATO air raids, they let loose poor excuses, describing them as not deliberate one and accidental bombing. 
					
					 The U.S. violation of sovereignty and human right abuses in Pakistan teach a serious lesson to many countries of the world.
					
					 No illusion should be harbored about the U.S.
					
					 Any illusion about it will ruin one's destiny.

articles.title: FTA Is Means of Plunder by U.S.: South Korean paper
articles.content:
FTA Is Means of Plunder by U.S.: South Korean paper 
						

					Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Internet paper Jaju Minbo carried an article titled "History will certainly judge the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement" on Dec. 12.
					
					 The means of plunder by the U.S. are globalization, opening and free trade, noted the article, describing them as cause of poverty affecting more than half of the world population.
					
					 In particular, the main target of plunder by the U.S. is south Korea, it noted, saying the U.S. is bleeding the south Korean people white as south Korean banks are subordinated to it.
					
					 The U.S. is trying to expand the scope of plunder to all fields including agriculture, electricity, railways, medical service and media through the FTA, said the article.
					
					 It emphasized that the nation and history will certainly judge those sycophantic and traitorous forces including the "Grand National Party" which seek coercive conclusion of the humiliating agreement.

articles.title: Punishment of "Government" and GNP Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Punishment of "Government" and GNP Urged in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea on Monday made public an appeal urging the struggle to punish the dictatorial regime and the "Grand National Party".
					
					 Recently in south Korea such deeds against democracy have been committed one after another as the GNP's sudden passage of "motion calling for the ratification of the Free Trade Agreement", which threatens the people's rights to existence, and the cyber attack on the Central Election Commission, the appeal noted.
					
					 The people's wrath at despotism by the GNP and the power body is skyscraping and the candlelight protests are sweeping south Korea as a whole, it said, adding:
					
					 If the forces, engrossed in railroading and destroying the order of society, are not removed from the political arena for good, the minimum right to existence, elementary democratic rights and, furthermore, the desire for peaceful reunification will be trampled down more ruthlessly.
					
					 What awaits the dictatorial regime is the stern punishment by the people, the appeal said, calling for developing the candlelight raised by the people in every part of south Korea into a mammoth torch to drive out the GNP and the "government".

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Assumption of KPA Supreme Commandership Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Assumption of KPA Supreme Commandership Observed

					Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea released the 30th issue of its bulletin to mark the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The bulletin in an article titled "Defender of Socialism" said:
					
					 Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il visited the military post covered with shrub pine trees on Jan. 1, 1995, the first New Year's Day after the demise of President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, to hold higher the banner of Songun.
					
					 He formulated the Songun policy as the basic political mode under socialism and put forward the People's Army as the main force of the revolution. 
					
					 In an article titled "Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill" the bulletin introduced the mill associated with the leadership feats of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy released a bulletin "Invincible Power" on Dec. 8 to mark the 20th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's assumption of KPA supreme commandership.
					
					 His assumption of KPA supreme commandership enabled the DPRK to advance dynamically along the road of socialism despite the imperialists' anti-DPRK moves, displaying its dignity as the invincible power, the bulletin said.
					
					 Thanks to his Songun policy the politico-ideological position of the DPRK has been cemented in every way and the single-minded unity of the Korean society strengthened into the solidest one that can not be broken even by nuclear weapon, it added.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Marked in Switzerland
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Marked in Switzerland 
						

					Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on Dec. 4 posted on Internet homepage an article titled "Anniversary of Songun Revolution" to mark the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero,.
					
					 The article said: 
					
					 Kim Jong Il has wisely led the army building, holding aloft the banner of the Songun idea created by President Kim Il Sung for the past 20 years. 
					
					 Under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il the KPA has won victory after victory in the showdown with the U.S. imperialists and reliably defended the socialist bulwark. It has also grown up to be the matchless army able to decisively defeat any military threat and aggression of the imperialists. 
					
					 The Korean people praise the revolutionary feats of Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu, with the approach of her 94th birth anniversary, the article said, adding: 
					
					 Kim Jong Suk is a model revolutionary who devoted her all to guarding safety of Kim Il Sung and faithfully aiding his work. She is the great mother of revolution who brought up Kim Jong Il to be son of the country and brilliant Songun commander of Mt. Paektu carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche. 
					
					 Her life will be everlasting with the history as she performed undying exploits for the country and the nation.

articles.title: Significant Days of DPRK Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Significant Days of DPRK Marked Abroad

					Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Seminars and lectures took place in Ethiopia and Peru between Dec. 3 and 8 to mark the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					 The secretary general of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea in his report at a seminar said that the 20 years of Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the KPA are a shining history in which he put the national defence capability on the highest phase, firmly defended socialism and opened a new era of building a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					 The chief of a branch of the study group in a lecture told about the life of Kim Jong Suk devoted to safety of President Kim Il Sung and comrades and people. 
					
					 The secretary general of the Peruvian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and other speakers noted that the greatest feat of Kim Jong Il is that he defeated every challenge of the imperialists and reliably defended and glorified the socialist cause and the dignity of the country and the nation with his unique Songun politics. 
					
					 They stressed that the exploits of Kim Jong Suk who brought about bright future of Korea and made contribution to the liberation of the country and development of the women's movement will be ever- lasting.

articles.title: Russian Expert Concerned about U.S. Military Approach to Russia, China
articles.content:
Russian Expert Concerned about U.S. Military Approach to Russia, China

					 Moscow, December 13 (KCNA) -- The president of the Russian Academy of Geopolitics voiced deep concern about the U.S. military approach to the boundaries of Russia and China in Central Asia.  
					
					 Leonid Ivashov told a recent press conference that the U.S. and NATO are seeking to keep some 15 military bases in Afghanistan and some of their weapons there even after withdrawing their troops by 2014.
					
					 This development will pose a threat to Russia and China, he said. 
					
					 The appearance of new foreign military bases near the Russian and Chinese borders will lead to a great change in the geopolitical situation of the region, compelling the strategic partners to cope with the security threat with concerted efforts, he predicted. 
					
					 He also called for taking a preemptive measure to respond to the U.S. strategy aimed to make a comeback to Asia.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Promoting Modernization of Military Equipment
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Promoting Modernization of Military Equipment
						

					 Beijing, December 13 (KCNA) -- Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, called for opening up a new phase in the modernization of military equipment. 
					
					 Addressing a recent meeting held in Beijing, he said it is important to accelerate the modernization of the Chinese army's equipment.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the production of military equipment in the period of the 11th five-year plan and discussed the tasks to be fulfilled in the next five-year plan period.        
					
					 Guo also called on the army to increase the capacity of carrying out various military missions based on IT with emphasis put on enhancing the capacity of winning a local war.

articles.title: China Adopts Plan for Medicine Security
articles.content:
China Adopts Plan for Medicine Security
						

					 Beijing, December 13 (KCNA) -- Wen Jiabao, premier of the State Council of China, adopted a 2011-2015 state plan for medicine security at a recently held executive meeting of the State Council.    
					
					 The meeting discussed fully implementing the responsibility system for medicine security and intensifying information and education activities so that the people can use medicines in a safe way.

articles.title: China Calls for Increasing Support for Developing Nations
articles.content:
China Calls for Increasing Support for Developing Nations 

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- China's deputy permanent representative to the United Nations called on the international community to boost support for developing nations.     
					
					 Speaking at a recent UN General Assembly session, he said the developed nations should fulfill their promise with sincerity to provide developing nations with enough and sustained aid fund.    
					
					 He also urged the international community to help developing nations have big say in the world economic management.

articles.title: Hebei Province Takes Efforts to Address Drinking Water Problem
articles.content:
Hebei Province Takes Efforts to Address Drinking Water Problem
						

					 Beijing, December 14 (KCNA) -- Hebei Province in China has taken positive and successful efforts for solving drinking water problem for people in the countryside.
					
					  It has become possible to supply clean water to a total of 3.48 million farm population in the province this year.

articles.title: Iranian Minister Calls U.S. Virtual Embassy "Trap to Recruit Spies"
articles.content:
Iranian Minister Calls U.S. Virtual Embassy "Trap to Recruit Spies"
						

					 Tehran, December 13 (KCNA) -- Iran's Intelligence Minister Heidar Moslehi said Sunday that the launch of a virtual embassy for Iranians by the United States is a trap for espionage.
					
					 "Those who might be deceived by the website of this virtual embassy must be warned that this (initiative) is a form of bait to entrap them for spying," Moslehi was quoted as saying. 
					
					 Moslehi said the website follows the same line as the former U.S. embassy in Iran, adding that an embassy can only be established with the approval of both countries involved.

articles.title: Iran Will Not Send Back Downed U.S. Drone: Deputy Commander
articles.content:
Iran Will Not Send Back Downed U.S. Drone: Deputy Commander

					 Tehran, December 13 (KCNA) -- The deputy commander of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps of Iran on Dec. 11 said that Iran will never send back the U.S. drone downed by it.
					
					 The U.S. drone's intrusion into Iran's airspace is a hostile act, he said, warning that Iran will take tougher corresponding steps in the future.
					
					 Iran cannot send the symbol of aggression back to those keen on gathering secret and important information related to the state security, he noted, adding that the capture of drone is Iran's victory as well as U.S. defeat in information and technological warfare.

articles.title: Iran's Armed Forces Warn U.S. over Drone Intrusion
articles.content:
Iran's Armed Forces Warn U.S. over Drone Intrusion
						

					 Tehran, December 13 (KCNA) -- The deputy chief of the Staff of the General Command of Armed Forces of Iran on Dec. 10 served a strong warning to the United States over its drone intrusion into Iran's airspace.
					
					 The armed forces of Iran will not limit its defense action to the country's border only but strongly react to the U.S. hostile acts of destroying the world security, he said.
					
					 He demanded the U.S. administration apologize for the illegal and hostile drone intrusion.

articles.title: Palestinian Officials Condemn Remarks by U.S. Presidential Candidate
articles.content:
Palestinian Officials Condemn Remarks by U.S. Presidential Candidate

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Palestinian officials on Saturday condemned U.S. Republican presidential candidate Newt Gingrich for his remarks against Palestinians.
					
					 Gingrich said that the Palestinians were "invented" people and do not have the right to get a statehood. 
					
					The comments of Gingrich were "cheap and gall," said Salam Fayyad, Palestinian prime minister. "The most hardliners in Israel have not even issued such speech."

articles.title: Palestinian Dies after Israeli Troops Fired Tear Gas
articles.content:
Palestinian Dies after Israeli Troops Fired Tear Gas
						

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A Palestinian protester died Saturday after he was severely injured by tear gas fired by Israeli soldiers near the West Bank city of Ramallah.
					
					 He got injured on Friday during a weekly demonstration held in Nabi Saleh village against Jewish settlement activities and the construction of the West Bank barrier.
					
					 Six other protesters were also wounded in the incident. Such atrocities of the Israeli army are sparking off strong protest and denunciation by the international community.

articles.title: Lebanese PM Condemns U.S. Violation of Iran's Airspace
articles.content:
Lebanese PM Condemns U.S. Violation of Iran's Airspace

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Lebanese Prime Minister Najib Mikati said his country, which has been the victim of frequent border violations of the Zionist regime, strongly condemns violation of Iran's airspace by the United States. 
					
					 Mikati was speaking in a meeting with Iran's Ambassador to Beirut Gholamreza Roknabadi on Saturday. 
					
					 He said U.S. action was against UN Charter and international law.

articles.title: Hezbollah Accuses U.S. Embassy in Lebanon of Hosting CIA Recruitment Center
articles.content:
Hezbollah Accuses U.S. Embassy in Lebanon of Hosting CIA Recruitment Center
						

					 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Lebanese Shiite armed group Hezbollah has revealed over the weekend that the United States' Central Intelligence Agency has used the U.S. Embassy compound in Awkar, north of Beirut, as a venue to recruit Lebanese informants to spy on it.
					
					 According to the report aired on the Hezbollah-affiliated Al-Manar TV station, the CIA had tasked a team of 10 officers, registered as diplomats at the U.S. Embassy, of recruiting Lebanese spies to gather information on Hezbollah's officials and fighters along with the addresses of the party's arms depots.
					
					 Speaking during a rally in Beirut on Saturday evening, Deputy Secretary General of Hezbollah Sheikh Naeem Qassem said that the information revealed by Al-Manar, should be considered as "only a small fraction" of data owned by Hezbollah on the activities of the CIA in Lebanon.

articles.title: Cuba Makes Efforts for Environmental Protection
articles.content:
Cuba Makes Efforts for Environmental Protection 
						

					 Havana, December 14 (KCNA) -- Cuba is putting efforts into protecting environment in the Gulf of Havana.
					
					 A state executive group, organized by the Cuban government, carried out plans for environmental protection in the area including water purification system and garbage disposal.
					
					 2,000 odd students conducted active information service on the issue of environmental protection among residents.
					
					 As a result, more than 55 percent of the contamination factors have been removed from the Gulf.

articles.title: Entidades femeninas llaman a abrir era de paz y reunificacion
articles.content:
Entidades femeninas llaman a abrir era de paz y reunificacion 

					Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Las direcciones femeninas de los Comites del Norte y el Sur de Corea para la Ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio publicaron el dia 14 la siguiente resolucion conjunta: 
					
					En el decurso de la historia de la ocupacion del territorio nacional por parte de los imperialistas japoneses, la division nacional, la guerra y la guerra fria, tambien nuestras mujeres coreanas han experimentado los sufrimientos. 
					
					En ese proceso nos damos clara cuenta de que la paz es la vida y es una cuestion importante relacionada con el destino de la nacion. 
					
					Tras tomar parte en el simposio sobre la paz de Asia y el papel de la mujer, efectuado en medio de la division nacional, las mujeres de ambas partes coreanas sembraron la paz mediante la cooperacion en la solucion del problema de ex consoladoras sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones y otras diversas actividades para la ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio e hicieron todo lo posible para el respecto. 
					
					En estos dias se empeoran las relaciones intercoreanas, debido a lo cual se interrumpio el intercambio entre las mujeres Norte-Sur y se agrava cada dia mas la tension militar en el Mar Oeste de Corea. 
					
					Las mujeres coreanas desean ardientemente la paz en este territorio. 
					
					Esperando que 2012 se haga el ano de esperanza para abrir una nueva coyuntura de viraje de la paz y la reunificacion, las mujeres de ambas partes coreanas deciden como lo siguiente: 
					
					Primero, nosotras, siendo protagonistas de la reconciliacion y la unidad nacionales, la paz y la reunificacion, haremos ingentes esfuerzos por frenar la guerra y lograr la paz en este territorio. 
					
					Haremos todo lo posible por eliminar la fuente raigal de la confrontacion y la guerra en esta tierra patria y legar a las generaciones venideras la paz duradera y la patria reunificada. 
					
					Elevaremos nuestro papel para rechazar todas las barreras institucionales y las teorias conflictivas que impiden los viajes, los contactos y los encuentros por la reunificacion entre el Norte y el Sur y crean el antagonismo y la desconfianza. 
					
					Segundo, nos levantaremos activamente en la ejecucion de la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre. 
					
					He aqui la paz del pais, la radiante perspectiva de la reunificacion y el porvenir de la nacion.
					
					La unica salida para eliminar lo mas pronto posible la coyuntura de confrontacion de hoy y abrir una nueva fase de la paz y la reunificacion reside en la ejecucion de la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur, lo cual contribuira a la paz del Nordeste Asiatico y el resto del mundo.
					
					Enarbolaremos la bandera de la Declaracion Conjunta N-S y rechazaremos estrictamente todos los actos conflictivos que obstaculizan las actividades de las entidades de las mujeres y de distintos sectores del Norte y el Sur para llevarla a efecto. 
					
					Fortaleceremos mas las actividades solidarias de las mujeres de ambas partes para convertir en el mar en paz el Mar Oeste de Corea que contiene el peligro de conflictos armados y la guerra entre ambas partes coreanas, segun indica la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre.
					
					Tercero, Consolidaremos la solidaridad para la resolucion del problema de ex consoladoras sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones y la proteccion de los derechos humanos de ellas.
					
					El problema de ex consoladoras esta definido por la ONU como un crimen antihumanitario y los paises damnificados demandan al gobierno japones la disculpa y la indemnizacion por el respecto.
					
					El mitin de miercoles en el Sur de Corea para demandar la reflexion, la disculpa y la indemnizacion del gobierno japones por el problema de ex consoladoras acoge el 14 de diciembre de este ano la milenaria ceremonia.
					
					Es muy lamentable que no se hayan logrados los esfuerzos de las mujeres Norte-Sur por conmemorar en conjunto el 1000o mitin de miercoles.
					
					A traves de los testimonios y simposios sobre el caso de ex consoladoras sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones, cobraremos sin falta la disculpa y la indemnizacion por los crimenes antieticos y los actos hostiles de toda indole perpetrados por Japon contra la nacion coreana, y en esta lucha solidarizaremos ampliamente con la ONU y otras organizaciones internacionales y las entidades ultramarinas.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, frustraremos las maniobras de nueva agresion de Japon que pretende volver a danar la soberania de la nacion coreana negando y tergiversando su historia de agresion del pasado e insistiendo en su "derecho a la posesion del islote Tok". 
					
					Nosotras que ocupamos la mitad de la poblacion, haremos todos los esfuerzos por lograr la paz y la reunificacion del pais.
					
					Reiteramos que seremos protagonistas del radiante futuro de la reunificacion y la prosperidad comun de la nacion.

articles.title: En 2011 se registran innovaciones en la industria ligera de RPDC
articles.content:
En 2011 se registran innovaciones en la industria ligera de RPDC
						

					Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Los obreros de la rama de la industria ligera lograron una innovacion sin precedente, en acato al llamamiento del editorial conjunto, publicado con motivo del Ano Nuevo 2011, de dar acicate otra vez este ano a la industria ligera.
					
					En todas las localidades del pais se han construido las fabricas de industria ligera como modelos de nuevo siglo y se ha elevado el nivel modernizado y cientifico de la produccion de articulos de consumo popular.
					
					La Fabrica Textil de Pyongyang, la Fabrica Textil de Sinuiju, la Fabrica de Portaminas de Pyongyang y otras muchas fabricas modernizaron sus procesos productivos.
					
					Quedo reconstruido el taller de hilanderia de la Fabrica Textil de Lana de Hamhung, que dio inicio a la produccion de telas de vinalon. Y se ha acondicionado el proceso de produccion de fibrana en la Fabrica de Fibras Quimicas de Chongjin, contribuyendo al mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo.
					
					En la rama de industria de zapatos elevaron la calidad del cuero sintetico y produjeron por su propia cuenta distintos materiales secundarios como sustancias adhesivas.
					
					Los obreros de las fabricas de zapatos de distintas localidades produjeron nuevos productos de mas de 200 generos.
					
					El taller de la arepa de harina de trigo rellena de la Fabrica de Alimentos Kumsong se ha convertido en una base de produccion de alimentos instantaneos, y la Fabrica de Elaboracion de Stevia de Pyongyang, en la de elaboracion en gran cantidad de los edulcorantes.
					
					Las bases de procesamiento de alimentos como la Fabrica de Alimentos para Ninos de Pyongyang y los  Combinados de Alimentos de Susongchon y Paekunsan activan la produccion acelerando la modernizacion.
					
					En la rama de industria local, los habitantes del distrito de Changsong libraron dinamicamente la reconstruccion de las fabricas distritales.
					
					Hoeryong, Kanggye, Tanchon, Musan, Riwon y otras localidades acondicionan modernamente las fabricas de industria local segun la demanda de nuevo siglo.
					
					En la II Exposicion de Articulos del Almacen No. 1 de Pyongyang, la Exposicion Otonal de Mercancias de la Tienda Subterranea de Pyongyang y la Exposicion Nacional de Articulos de Consumo Popular se presentaron cientos de miles de productos de industria ligera y articulos de consumo popular, los cuales satisfacen con suficiencia la creciente demanda de los trabajadores.
					
					Por otra parte, se ha aumentado mas que la atencion social y estatal sobre esta rama.
					
					Todos estos exitos son el fruto de la sabia direccion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien durante todo el ano hizo incansables esfuerzos por la mejora de las condiciones de vida del pueblo.
